Hey Ivan, thank you for this series on unnumbered interfaces! Can you please say more about the "loopback interface hack" you mentioned in this post (and also in Back to Basics: The History of IP Interface Addresses and Packet Forwarding and Routing over Unnumbered Interfaces)?

I may be totally off the mark here, but is the "loopback interface hack" about repurposing an address from the 127.0.0.0/8 space as a routable address for a point-to-point link, and modifying the corresponding routing table entries to route traffic to such address(es) differently?

Here's an illustration of what I mean: https://excalidraw.com/#json=9GRLGN0jn6N6kqMtFL0Aq,KX21Aet2Luct85DDPbhPPw
